title: CompTIA Network+ N10-009 Quiz 3
description: Advanced practice questions for the CompTIA Network+ N10-009 exam

questions.questionText: A network technician is troubleshooting a connectivity issue between two buildings connected via fiber. The link light is on at both ends but users cannot access resources. Using a protocol analyzer, the technician notices that frames are being received with errors. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause?
options: Incorrect VLAN configuration
Incompatible fiber types (single-mode vs. multi-mode)
IP address conflict
Misconfigured default gateway
questions.explanation: When the link light is on (indicating physical connectivity) but frames are being received with errors, it suggests a physical layer issue despite apparent connectivity. Incompatible fiber types (using single-mode fiber with multi-mode transceivers or vice versa) can cause this exact symptom where the link appears to be up but data cannot be properly transmitted.

questions.questionText: Which of the following statements about STP (Spanning Tree Protocol) is FALSE?
options: STP prevents broadcast storms in redundant network topologies
STP automatically selects the root bridge based on the lowest bridge priority
STP allows for multiple active paths between switches
STP uses BPDUs to exchange information between switches
questions.correctAnswer: STP allows for multiple active paths between switches
questions.explanation: STP actually blocks redundant paths to prevent loops, allowing only one active path between switches at a time. While newer technologies like MSTP and TRILL allow multiple active paths, traditional STP does not.

questions.questionText: A company is implementing a new VoIP system. The network administrator needs to ensure quality of service for voice traffic. Which of the following should be configured?
options: Port mirroring on all switches
QoS with DSCP marking for voice traffic
MAC address filtering on all access points
VLAN pruning on all trunks
questions.correctAnswer: QoS with DSCP marking for voice traffic
questions.explanation: DSCP (Differentiated Services Code Point) marking is used to prioritize voice traffic in QoS implementations, ensuring low latency and jitter for VoIP communications. This allows the network to identify and prioritize voice packets over other traffic types.

questions.questionText: A network technician is troubleshooting a wireless network issue. Users report slow performance and frequent disconnections. The technician notices that the wireless access point is using channel 6 in the 2.4 GHz band. What should the technician do FIRST?
options: Increase the transmit power of the access point
Perform a wireless site survey to identify a less congested channel
Enable WPA3 encryption
Update the access point firmware
questions.correctAnswer: Perform a wireless site survey to identify a less congested channel
questions.explanation: Channel 6 is the default channel for many devices and is often congested. Performing a wireless site survey to identify a less congested channel (such as 1 or 11 in the 2.4 GHz band) should be the first step in resolving wireless interference issues.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of a stateful firewall?
options: Maintains a state table of active connections
Can filter traffic based on application layer data
Operates primarily at Layer 3 and Layer 4 of the OSI model
Requires manual configuration of return traffic rules
questions.correctAnswer: Requires manual configuration of return traffic rules
questions.explanation: Stateful firewalls automatically track and allow return traffic for established connections, unlike stateless firewalls which require manual configuration of bidirectional rules. This is one of the key advantages of stateful inspection.

questions.questionText: A network administrator is implementing a new network design with multiple VLANs. Which of the following is the MOST secure method to allow inter-VLAN communication?
options: Configure a Layer 3 switch with ACLs between VLANs
Use a Layer 2 switch with trunk ports
Implement a hub between VLANs
Enable VLAN trunking on all ports
questions.correctAnswer: Configure a Layer 3 switch with ACLs between VLANs
questions.explanation: Using a Layer 3 switch with ACLs provides the most secure method for inter-VLAN communication, as it allows for traffic filtering and proper routing between VLANs while maintaining security through access control lists.

questions.questionText: Which of the following statements about IPv6 is TRUE?
options: IPv6 addresses are 128 bits long and written in hexadecimal notation
IPv6 requires NAT for Internet connectivity
IPv6 uses ARP for neighbor discovery
IPv6 headers are typically larger than IPv4 headers
questions.correctAnswer: IPv6 addresses are 128 bits long and written in hexadecimal notation
questions.explanation: IPv6 addresses are indeed 128 bits long and are written in hexadecimal notation, typically in eight groups of four hexadecimal digits separated by colons. IPv6 uses NDP (not ARP) for neighbor discovery, doesn't require NAT, and has a simplified header structure.

questions.questionText: A network technician is troubleshooting a slow network performance issue. The technician runs a packet capture and notices a large number of identical broadcast packets continuously circulating through the network. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause?
options: A Layer 2 network loop
Incorrect subnet mask configuration
Duplicate IP addresses
Misconfigured DHCP server
questions.explanation: A Layer 2 network loop causes broadcast storms, resulting in identical broadcast packets continuously circulating through the network, consuming bandwidth and causing performance degradation. This typically happens when STP is disabled or misconfigured.

questions.questionText: TRUE or FALSE: IEEE 802.1X provides port-based network access control that requires authentication before allowing devices to communicate on the network.
options: TRUE
FALSE
questions.explanation: IEEE 802.1X is a standard for port-based network access control (PNAC) that provides an authentication mechanism for devices wishing to connect to a network. It requires authentication before a port is enabled for normal communication.

questions.questionText: A security engineer is analyzing traffic and notices encrypted connections are being established to an unknown external IP address from multiple workstations. Which of the following tools would be BEST to identify the specific applications generating this traffic?
options: Protocol analyzer
Port scanner
Bandwidth analyzer
Cable tester
questions.explanation: A protocol analyzer (packet sniffer) would be the best tool to identify specific applications generating the encrypted traffic as it can examine packet details including source/destination ports, timestamps, and protocols that help identify the applications in use.
